column1: # Evidence Log: Track all research findings with citations
# - timestamp: When evidence was collected (ISO format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS)
# - source_type: journal | conference | book | web | preprint | codebase | pr_review
# - key_finding: Main takeaway from this source (1-2 sentences)
# - confidence: high | medium | low (based on source quality and clarity)
# Format: BibTeX (@article{...}) or APA (Author (Year). Title.) recommended

column3: GitHub PR #68: Fix list command to accept all argument. https://github.com/wildcard/caro/pull/68
column4: PR #68 has test failures on Linux/macOS/Windows; changes 15 files with 800+ lines
column6: Direct inspection of PR diff and CI check results

column4: clap 4.5+ supports trailing_var_arg=true and num_args=0.. for capturing unquoted trailing arguments
Shell operators (> | < >> 2> & ;) are defined metacharacters that terminate command arguments
Unix conventions prioritize explicit flags > stdin > arguments for multiple input sources
column6: Confirmed by user; matches cat/grep behavior

column4: Empty/whitespace-only input should show help message (not error)
column6: Explicit user requirement during discovery phase

column4: Shell operators must follow BSD/GNU best practices and terminate prompt parsing
Fresh implementation preferred over fixing PR #68 directly due to test failure risk
column6: User confirmed Option A after presentation of alternatives

column4: Minimal changes approach selected over comprehensive refactoring
column6: User chose Option A to reduce scope and risk

column4: TDD mandatory with RED-GREEN-REFACTOR cycle; library-first architecture required

column3: ripgrep and fd crates (examples of clap trailing_var_arg usage)
column4: Battle-tested Rust CLI tools use trailing_var_arg for accepting unquoted arguments
column6: Reference implementations showing pattern works in production
